column1: Hareth (b. ) was the elder daughter of Halmir
column2: Chieftain of the Haladin of the Haladin
column3: and sister of Haldir (Chieftain of the Haladin)

column1: In  she married Galdor (Lord of Dor-lómin)
column2: lord of the House of Hador

column3: so the name probably means "Lady" in the Haladin tongue.

column1: Robert Foster also suggests that Hareth means "Lady"
column2: however the entry erroneously labels the name as Quenya.

column3: was a later addition to the House of Haleth family tree.  Before she was introduced Hareths name was "Hiriel".
